content.description:
Smooth Jazz Sunday is just the ticket if Heavy Metal isn't your bag, baby.  

  P1 Same as Red Lung to the mega ledge. Move belay right 70 feet. Belay takes fingers gear. 5.7b R 100 feet. 

  P2 Start on Heavy Metal Saturday, clipping the 3rd bolt with a runner, and glide out left to the mega jug in space. Find your flow and be-bob up left past awesome holds for all the hip cats. Improv up the groovy slash and hold on as your arms start to feel like they had a grand piano dropped on them.  5.12- 70 feet.  

  Lounge cred possible by finishing up P3 of either Red Lung or Heavy Metal Saturday.
content.protection: 1X BD#1C3-BD#1C4. 9 Bolts on P2 w/ optional fingers piece.
content.location: Start at the notch of Slingshot Rock. Rap route, 70m works best for 1st pitch rap.

content.description: A slightly mellower way to start the day. Zig zag up ramps to the corner and a strange crux. Above the ledge, enjoy fun headwall to a tricky finish!
content.protection: Single set for P1. P2 is 10 or so bolts.
content.location: Move right 20 feet from the top of the approach pitch. Start on a hollow flake feature.

climbs.name: Pizza Party Friday
climbs.fa: B. McCord J. Snyder Z. Harrison

content.description: Climb some bolts up a steep swoop. Fall off.

Heavy Metal Saturday is the Saturday following any Monday holiday. More often then Christmas and twice as loud. Closely followed by heavy metal Sunday.  

  P1 Same as Red Lung. 5.7b R. 100ft. Move belay right 70 feet on big ledge. Belay takes fingers gear.   P2 Crank up the volume and sand ape up past locks, jams and crimps. Down tune into delicate post rock slab. Headbang your way to the chains on encore jugs. 5.11 70 feet.    P3 Leave the green room and mantle the bogus block. Solo neat holds into world tour finger crack. Private jet bulge to center stage. Double encore arête past 3 bolts to upper VIP room. 5.10 80 feet
content.protection: 1X BD#0C3-#1C4 w/ 2X .3-.5C4's. 9 draws and runners. Rap route. 70m works best for 1st pitch rap.
content.location: Start at the notch between Slingshot Rock and the Camels Head. Same first pitch as Red Lung. Starts off base camp ledge 70 feet right from 1st pitch anchor.

content.description: Intense, amazing, technical and unrelenting. That is Black Cobra.P1 Same as Red Lung. Move belay right 50 feet on big ledge. Belay at bolt. 5.7 R 100 feet.P2 Crank up black jugs and sidepulls to the Black Cobra jug at the 3rd bolt. Now prepare to strike! From the shelf, crank into the sloping rail and mantel, moving right past the snake eye pockets to the jug ledge. Style cool features to an optional thin hands placement before the chains. 5.12-(+/-) 80 feet.Bonus points available by finishing up P3 of either Heavy Metal Saturday or Red Lung.
content.protection: 1X BD#1C3-#1C4 for P1. P2 9 BoltZZZZZZ!!!!! 70m works best for 1st pitch rap.
content.location: Start in the Notch between Slingshot Rock and the Camels Head.

content.description: The routes on this almost sport wall all feature featured quality stone with unique holds and fun climbing. Best on cool sunny days, its a mini crag in a awesome setting. The routes all have an approach trad pitch to get to a big ledge that cuts across the wall, granting access to the routes. But once you are there, the base camp crag attitude and great climbing are well worth it.
